comment: such a great lecturer. What a treat that this towering figure in atomic physics can also excellently teach

The explanation for what Forbidden Transitions (~1:04:00) are was such a relief. I remember my physical chemistry teacher saying they never happen but they do and it's never explained well. Thank you MIT OCW for having these lectures online!
https://youtu.be/4fZPNSMiRvk?t=31m50s sorry isn't div of a vector a scale? how could div of plane wave create a k vector?
The expression was a scalar: it was the dot product of two vectors (e_hat * k_vector) which is a scalar. Hope that helped?
